dialogues.speaker: A MASSIVE STEEL HEAD
dialogues.text: Our first thought: DR. DOOM?  But it's not moving.  A welder's torch sparks into frame in the hands of a sculpt on scaffolding.  This is art, an epic 20 foot statue goin of a business mogul (VICTOR VON DOOM) in whose generously extended hands sit two intertwined columns of DNA.  His f is chiseled, angular, perfect (too perfect).  Past sparks MOVE down to pick up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REED RICHARDS and BEN GRIMM head toward the soaring glass atrium of VDI Headquarters.  Designed to inspire awe, it does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High open space, exposed structural elements.  Obviously aimed at first time visitors to create feelings of... smallness, inadequacy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben glances at Reed, who looks a little nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good thing it ain't workin... Reed, what are we doing here?  This guy's fast-food, strip-mall science --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This wasn't our first stop, in case you forgot NASA.  And Victor's not that bad.  He's just a little... (seeing the statue) Larger than life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move past the statue, into the sprawling atrium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's financed some of the biggest breakthroughs of this century.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd never know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He motions to a high-tech ORB, showing FOOTAGE of VDI's accomplishments: a safe and clean nuclear facility, the f private Space Station. All images have VICTOR front and center, glad-handling Ge Bush, Tony Blair, shady International Leaders.  The last image is Victor holding the AMERICA'S CUP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus.  That too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They reach three stern RECEPTIONISTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed Richards and Ben Grimm to see --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A receptionist cuts him off, handing them each a pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Executive elevator, top floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the price for a smile round here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They head for the elevator.  Reed carries a small, black As they enter the elevator, steel doors shut and we CUT T

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large, dark office.  Ben in the corner.  He yawns, watches... BRIGHT HOLOGRAMS: Stars.  Planets.  They hover in the air making the room feel like a majestic portal into outer sp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My research suggests that exposure to a high-energy cosmic storm born on solar winds might have triggered the evolution of early planetary life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REED stands among the holograms, speaking to a MYSTERIOUS FIGURE in shadow behind a desk.  An ominous, PULSATING RE CLOUD covers the stars.  It washes over a hologram of EAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In six weeks another cloud with the same elemental profile will pass Earth's orbit.  A study in space could advance our knowledge about the structure of the human genome, and help cure countless diseases, extend human life --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SHADOW clears his throat.  Reed speeds up, emotional.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give kids the chance to be stronger, healthier, less prone to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn it off.  Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The figure's DEEP VOICE pierces the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I haven't fully explained my --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you have... Imagination. Creativity.  Passion.  Those were always your trademarks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lights brighten, revealing the face behind the voice: VIC VON DOOM.  35, handsome, commanding.  He looks almost... airbrushed.  He drops a WIRED magazine to the desk.  REED on the cover over the words: RICHARDS BANKRUPT, GRANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But dreams don't pay the bills, do they? (a condescending smile) Same old Reed, the hopeless optimist.  Still reaching for the stars, with the world on your back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember in school we talked about working together.  That's what I was about to explain...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed presses the remote.  Another hologram appears: A SHU slowly approaching AN ORBITING SPACE STATION.  Both bear VON DOOM INDUSTRIES logo.  Victor smiles, more intrigued.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it's not my money you want.  It's my toys... Tell me: if NASA doesn't trust you, why should I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor is a step ahead.  Reed pauses, thrown for a beat. wakes up, suspicious.  Victor notices.  He notices everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my job.  To stay a step ahead.  To know what other men don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben gets close to Reed, turning toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't take this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low, quiet) Ben.  This is business.  Just work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.  Victor cracks a smile, enjoying the tension.  An

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's right, Ben.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn to see...SUE STORM (demure, stunning) standing corner...possibly for the whole presentation.  A little c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you both know my Director of Genetic Research, Susan Storm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heya Susie. (under breath, to Reed) One more thing he's got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sue gracefully walks into the office, only taking her eye off of Reed to give Ben a warm hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben, it's been too long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives Reed a polite handshake.  Victor watches carefu Reed looks uncomfortable in her gaze.  A little tongue-ti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're, you've, I mean, how have you bee--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor sizes them up.  He puts a hand on Sue's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't going to be a problem, is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ancient history.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor smiles, eyeing Sue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  Then you're just in time to hear the great Reed Richards ask me for help. (to Reed) You know, you made a lot of folks at MIT feel like a junior high science fair.  So you'll excuse me if I savor the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben tightens.  A hard beat.  Reed sucks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You back this mission, and I'll sign over a fair percentage of any applications or --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The number's seventy-five.  And it's applications and patents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about his first born?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quiet) Ben, the money's not important.  We could save lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sue gives a thin smile -- a flicker of old feelings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty-five percent of a billion is enough to keep the lights on, isn't it?  Maybe even pay off your fourth mortgage on the Baxter Building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at Victor.  How does he know all this...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deal...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed looks at Ben, who shakes his head softly no.  But Reed...drops a nod.  Done.  Victor smiles, offers a handshake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well then, to our future.  Together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor squeezes.  Hard.  His other hand on Sue's shoulder

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funny how things turn out, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hilarious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Reed and Sue lock eyes, Ben watches Victor.  Wary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Director of Communications LEONARD enters, checking files

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If Reed's right, then this little trip will double our stock offering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if he's not...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed's always right.  Good thing he doesn't always know what he's got...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed and Ben step into the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knew about NASA.  What if he made the call to shut us down --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben, think about all the people we can help if this works --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you should think about yourself for once.  You always let this guy push you round --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got what we wanted.  That's enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I know.  I'm just worried about what he wants... Speaking of which...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed follows Ben's eyes to...SUE.  She joins them.  Doors shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure about this, Reed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods, head down.  He doesn't want eye contact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those solar winds are flaring, but I factored them into my coordinates and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was talking about us.  Working together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sue holds her eyes on Reed.  He is clearly uncomfortable her gaze.  Did the elevator just get smaller?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinking, talking fast) Well, uh, based on our history...you can handle the biogenetics, and I'll focus on the molecular physics.  Or, uhm, maybe I should take the biotech, you work the microscopes, since you have some background in electropho--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (droll, a little annoyed) Right.  That's exactly what I meant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shakes her head -- same old Reed.  He looks at her -- what did he say wrong?  Ben smiles, patting Reed on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Way to not overthink it. (to Sue) So when do we leave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll schedule the launch.  Call me in the morning to talk about resources and crew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She offers a business card.  Reed doesn't take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I, uh, think I remember the number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been changed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.  Ben grimaces.  Reed takes the card, his eyes down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As far as crew, I was hoping Ben could pilot the mission --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he's welcome to ride shotgun, but we already have a pilot on our payroll.  You remember my brother Johnny...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Ben's curdling smile, we DISSOLVE TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A helicopter shot through trees.  We soar over timberland and find something massive looming on the horizon: A SPACECRAFT.  A sleek take on a space shuttle.  Modern t combined with industrial design that NASA could never aff The craft's nose is pointed straight up, ready for launch WORKERS IN JUMPSUITS are scattered around the two-hundred foot tall scaffolding, performing routine checks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben stares up at the craft.  A sneer on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't do it.  I cannot do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: External SRBs, orbital system engines.  Its just like the shuttles you flew in --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I cannot take orders from that underwear model.  That wingnut washed out of NASA for sneaking two Victoria Secret wannabes into a flight  simulator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Youthful high spirits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk toward the base of the scaffolding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They crashed it into a wall.  A flight simulator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure he's matured since then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on JOHNNY STORM, leaning over to kiss a hot redhead PULL BACK TO REVEAL he's riding a MOTORCYCLE, and she's driving a red CORVETTE with license plate: FRANKIE.  PICK Reed and Ben, watching through binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When have I asked you to do something you absolutely said you could not do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had it at four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This makes five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed and Ben unpack gear into lockers.  Suddenly --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain on the bridge!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben goes to attention on reflex: Johnny snaps a picture w a digital camera.  Then advances, as Ben realizes who it is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Digital camera: $254.  Memory stick: $59.  The look on your hard-ass former CO's grill when he finds out he's your junior officer: priceless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben eyeballs Johnny, suddenly reaches up as if to grab hi Johnny flinches.  But Ben just reaches for Johnny's zippe adjusts his uniform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can handle the ship.  I can even handle Mr. Blonde Ambition.  But I don't know if I should be flying or playing Vegas in these suits.  Who the hell came up with them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sue enters, wearing her blue, wetsuit-like uniform, carry a stack of flightsuits.  She hands them out to the guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The synthetics act as a second skin, adapting to your individual needs to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep the hot side hot, and the cool side cool!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.  Fantastic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed stares at Sue in the skintight outfit.  She wonders, maybe hopes -- is he actually checking her out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Material made from self-regulating unstable molecules.  I've been working on a formula for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great minds think alike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess some think faster than others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor enters, wearing his custom-tailored flightsuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hired Armani to design the pattern.  These colors will look great on camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DOOR OPENS.  Leonard enters, in a sharp suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're ready for you, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Showtime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard leads Victor through the halls.  Victor checks himself in mirrors as he walks, fixing his hair, his unif

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our numbers are through the roof.  The IPO's tracking at fifty, sixty a share.  The bank's five times oversubscribed --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not just the money.  I could make money in my sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: History, Leonard.  History.  Everything else is conversation... (a beat) How's the other matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard pulls out a BOX.  Opens it: a TEN KARAT DIAMOND R

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry Winston sends his regards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hit a set of big doors.  Victor stops and looks into reflective, metallic surface on the wall.  He fixes one l strand of hair.  Perfect. Then he opens the door to...  SNAP!SNAP!SNAP!  WHIP-PAN a row of CAMERAS snapping shots

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Retrofitted into a makeshift press area.  Victor sits on platform, with reporters stretched out below him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today we stand on the edge of a new frontier.  In the furthest depths of outer space...we will find the secrets to inner space.  The final key to unlocking our genetic code lies in a cosmic storm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEHIND THE ACTION: Reed, Sue, Johnny and Ben walk past. crews barely notice, passing without even taking a pictur Our "Fantastic Four" are not exactly big news.  Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't that your speech?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's made a few changes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is your dream, Reed.  You should be the one up there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor's better at these things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just past the press area, they see...one woman standing, waiting.  This is DEBBIE, Ben's fiancГ©e.  And for the fi time in the entire film...Ben SMILES.  They hug, kissing. Johnny and Reed watch.  Reed glances at Sue, who walks ah Debbie slips a photo into Ben's flightsuit.  A tender bea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be watching over you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just get back soon, or I start looking for a new groom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben looks at the little ENGAGEMENT RING on her finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon as I'm back, I'm gonna trade that in for a bigger rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care about rocks, I care about you. (to Reed) You bring him back in one piece, or you can forget being Best Man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed nods, smiles.  Debbie gives Ben a last kiss.  Ben tu to Johnny, who gives a cocky smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell you smiling at?  Just keep your mouth shut, and your mind on those SMBs --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, the engines are SMEs. Hydrogenbase, carbon propellant.  Couple generations past your last ride. (at the threshold) I'm not as dumb as you look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben just glares at Reed.  This is going to be a long trip As they follow after Sue, we CUT BACK TO --

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR ON STAGE
dialogues.text: Mid-speech.  Playing behind him is REED'S HOLOGRAM: stars give way to a pulsating red cloud...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think of a world without genetic flaws -- no asthma, allergies, baldness, breast cancer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben and Reed hear the speech.  Ben bristles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with being bald...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor smiles at the crowd, commanding.  A true leader.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darwin discovered evolution.  Now we -- I -- will define it.  Only in America could...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The red cloud of cosmic rays wash over the Earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...a little country boy from Latveria build one of the biggest companies in the world, and truly reach the stars.  Now if you'll excuse me, history awaits...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On those words, the HOLOGRAM TRANSFORMS TO...Von Doom's SHUTTLE on the launch pad.  BOOM!  THRUSTERS FIRE WHITE H Smoke billows across the pad.  Ready for take off. Victor walks past the hologram and exits.  His departure perfectly timed with the shuttle LIFTING OFF. We push in on the shuttle, and follow the ship as it leav Earth's atmosphere.  BOOM -- booster rockets fall away an the shuttle fires its thrusters.  The hologram transition to... A shot of the SPACE STATION high above the Earth.  The shuttle enters from the top, lighting up the hologram wit engines afire.  As the shuttle approaches the station we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE SPACE STATION in the distance, rotating in orbit abov Earth.  THE SHUTTLE eases in and docks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor and Sue lead the others into the command center.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a "dad voice": to Ben) If you behave, maybe next time daddy'll let you drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep talking, there won't be a next time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed is focused on THE EARTH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long way from the projection booth at the Hayden Planetarium, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed turns towards her -- a little stunned that she would bring that up.  It's the first time she's been nice to hi far.  He smiles, gently, hesitantly, always hesitant with Sue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  Yes it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny and Ben exchange a look.  Reed keeps looking at th stars, eyes wide, like a little kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter the nerve center of the space station.  Victor goes to a computer console on the observation deck below. The windows are closed, so there's nothing to observe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to ground; via comm-link) Leonard, how's the feed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Recording, sir.  We see you perfectly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor glances at a camera mounted into the console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can monitor the cloud's approach and observe the tests from here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it safe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shields on the station should protect us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong, Ben?  Eighty-million dollars worth of equipment not enough for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben turns to Victor.  A little tension.  Reed cuts it:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's start loading those samples.  Get your suit ready, Ben.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor keeps his eyes on Ben.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you still do all the heavy lifting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor gives a friendly smile, patting Reed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you should have stayed back in the lab.  Field work never suited you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed doesn't defend himself.  Ben steps up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He does the talking.  I do the walking.  Got it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor holds tight to his smile.  He nods, condescending.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it.  So take a walk, Ben...I'm going to borrow Susan for a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben and Johnny read his eyes, as we CUT TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben preps for a space walk, putting on a helmet and boots Johnny unloads a set of clear sample boxes off of a cart, each containing a variety of plants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please tell me your dawg's not trying to rekindle things with my sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Course not.  Strictly business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, his eyes say different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, two hearts got busted last time.  Maybe she's not over it either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see: you got Victor, stud of the year, more coin than God?  Or Reed, the world's dumbest smart guy worth less than a postage stamp.  Hmmm, it's a toss-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put your tiny little mind at ease.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you wander off, boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny steps out of the air-lock and shuts the door.  He looks through a small window to see Ben give the thumbs u THE AIRLOCK DOOR opens, and Ben gracefully steps into spa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sue descends the stairs at Victor's behest.  Joins him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surprised I agreed to Reed's proposal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand the business reasons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, when you're looking at your future, it never hurts to find closure about the past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sue's eyes narrow.  What is this about...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan, every man dreams that he'll meet some woman he can give the world to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He presses a button and the observation deck's outer wind open up, revealing a spectacular, romantic view of the EA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In my case, it's not just a metaphor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While she stares out the window, Victor reaches into a pocket, revealing a RING BOX.  Sue looks unsettled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed checks data on a work station, set on a wall.  The results of his calculations are not what he expected... H sees WIND VELOCITY digits rise.  He does a double-take wh he sees the readout: EVENT THRESHOLD, T-MINUS 10:00.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...no...impossible.  It's...too fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind his back, Victor holds the ring box in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been with me two years now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sue doesn't know where this is going.  She treads lightly

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been a good two years, Victor... The company's accomplished so much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, of course, the company... But you see, I've come to realize all the accomplishments in the world mean nothing without someone to share them with --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, Victor, I hope I haven't done something to make you think...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is about to spring the ring on her.  She looks like a in headlights.  She opens her mouth, and...WHAM!  Doors s open.  REED RUSHES INTO THE ROOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor quickly puts the ring back in his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sue quickly moves to a nearby control panel to verify Ree claim.  Starts punching buttons.  Confirms Reed's finding with a nod.  Victor hardens, in control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got minutes until it hits, not hours...Victor, that storm's deadly -- the radiation's lethal.  We need to abort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get a grip.  Reed.  We didn't come all this way to lose our nerve at the first little glitch.  Just close the shields...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben's still out there --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So reel him in.  But we came here to do a job.  So let's do it.  Quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben is carefully arranging SAMPLE BOXES OF PLANTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben, we need you back inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben turns to see Reed and Johnny staring from a window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't done arranging your flowers, egghead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben.  This is serious.  Turn around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben sees Johnny motioning for Ben to look behind him.  Be turns and sees: THE COSMIC STORM, rumbling toward the station.  Not close, but not far.  That gets Ben's attent

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger that, on my way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns back towards the ship.  BEHIND HIM, the storm gr

dialogues.text: Victor rushes into the room, looks at the monitors.  Sees others near the airlock on one screen, and the approachin cloud on another.  Anxiety creeps across his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Event threshold in two minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed and Johnny stand by the airlock, waiting for Ben.  T heard the automated voice.  It panics Reed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Ben, come on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed, we're running out of time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wake of turbulence from the cloud hits Ben, making it harder to maneuver.  The cloud's tendrils snake toward hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They can see Ben outside the window, still twenty yards a The entire corridor rumbles.  Lights flicker and spark. watch helplessly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sue watches the monitor, also helpless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny... Reed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor, annoyed by the indecisiveness, marches right up t Sue.  Practically shoves her aside as he hits the INTERCO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed, you need to get up here so we can close the shields!  Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sue glares at Victor.  His lack of compassion shocks her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not until Ben is back inside!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too late for him, and soon it'll be too late for all of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor doesn't bother to wait for a response.  He takes o the console, punching keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raising the shields.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't leave them out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sue glares with as much contempt as her face can muster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch me.  Reed had his chance.  You can't help them any more than I can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.  She takes a step toward the door.  Not sure what t do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With one final glare, she bolts from the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed bites his lip.  Thinks.  He decides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor's right.  Johnny, get to the command center.  Close the shields.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about you?

dialogues.text: One look from Reed tells Johnny, he won't leave without B Johnny eyes Ben, steels his courage.  He's not going eith

dialogues.text: (to Ben) Come on big guy, you can do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny!  Reed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIVE...FOOOOUUUR...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLOW MOTION: Everyone frozen in position as: -- JOHNNY is hit with sparks of flame from a control pane -- REED REACHES out for Ben and the airlock door. -- VAPOR STREAM pours down on Sue from a blown gasket. -- THE SPACE DUST burns into Ben's skin. The station loses all power.  DARKNESS.

dialogues.text: As quickly as it came, the cloud passes on and whirls awa leaving the space station intact.  Power quietly flickers Silence.  Time resumes.  All four pick up exactly where t left off, unaware of anything that just happened to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor emerges from the rubble.  He stands, checks his bo A few scrapes, nothing serious.  A thin, throbbing CUT on head.  He touches the wound, but it is not bleeding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed and Johnny scramble to open the interior air lock do Sue joins them, as they pull Ben in.  They try to remove helmet.  We don't see his face, but he's clearly unconsci

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not responsive --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben!  Ben!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben, wake up!  Wake up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUBJECTIVE CAMERA, BEN'S POV: The blurry image of Johnny comes slowly into focus, standing beside a hospital bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where...where am I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back on Earth.  Victor's medical facility... We're in quarantine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed? ... Sue?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're fine.  Everybody else...is fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny looks away, as if he can't bear to lay eyes on him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear to you they've done everything humanly possible.  The best plastic surgeons in the world, Ben.  You had the best --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me a mirror...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny picks up a hand mirror on the bed table before Ben reach it, reluctant to give it to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They said that's not such a good idea, the shock alone could --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me the god damn mirror!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben grabs it from him.  Then slowly raises it to look and that...except for some serious stubble, Ben's totally nor

dialogues.text: Unfortunately, the doctors just couldn't do anything to fix your face!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He cackles as he heads for the door.  Ben heaves the mirr at him, breaking it into hundreds of pieces.  He turns to side-table, and grabs that picture of DEBBIE.  It calms h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed walks down the hall.  His hair is GRAYING at the temples.  He passes Johnny, who is smiling, still enjoyin his joke on Ben.  Johnny slows, looking at Reed's hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice 'do.  Going for the "grandpa" look?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed passes a mirror, slowing, seeing his gray hairs.  He keeps going.  He passes a partially open door.  He stops he catches a glimpse of Sue asleep in bed.  He sees a vas flowers.  He grabs a couple lilies, and enters. But Reed sees...the room is already FILLED with expensive flowers.  All from VICTOR.  Reed is trumped once again. A DOCTOR writes on Sue's chart.  A wall TV plays a press conference with Victor, outside the FACILITY.  He looks w for wear.  A few hairs out of place, and a small BANDAGE his face.  We PUSH INTO the press conference --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been accused in the past of moving science a little too fast --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Accused by who?  My competitors?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But surely this accident gives you pause --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danger is always part of discovery.  What would have happened if Ben Franklin never went out in a storm? Without risk, there's no reward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where's the reward?  You promised a cure-all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor pauses.  For the first time.  Just a flicker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you'll have it.  I've never come up short.  And I'm not going to start now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're still taking VDI public --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, of course.  I've never been more confident in the compan--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed mutes the television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's she doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stable.  Vitals are strong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed takes the clipboard, looks for himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood panels show no irradiation.  Good.  You'll step up this protocol, every --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four hours.  We know what we're doing... One more day of observation, then you're all cleared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Doctor takes his clipboard, and walks out.  Reed step Sue, with the drooping flowers in his hand.  Quiet:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sue...I want to tell you...I'm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHOOSH.  A NURSE rolls in with a tray bearing ten more extravagant bouquets.  Reed looks resigned.  He walks out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's allergic to orchids.  Put that Amaryllis Apapathos by her bed.  The African lilies?  They're her favorites.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed exits, dropping his two wilted lilies into the trash Sue opens one eye, as the big lilies land by the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SEXY NURSE wheels a testing station into Johnny's room. He's stripped down to Calvins, changing into a ski outfit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And where do we think we're going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know if "we've" noticed, but the sickest runs this side of the Alps are right outside that window --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've noticed... But doctor's orders, you're not allowed to leave until we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finish the tests, I know -- could you give me a hand with this zipper?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know this is not a ski resort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny opens the cardboard box, revealing a colorful fiberglass object the size of a briefcase.  In the blink an eye, he unfolds it into a LONG SNOWBOARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luckily grandma still sends care packages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nurse pops a thermometer in his mouth to shut him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thermometer in his mouth) Brubbles my Triddle Name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both pay more attention to his zipper than the digit read-out: it runs right up past 98.6, then accelerates fa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're hot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So are you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, you feel a little feverish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never felt better in my life.  When do you get off work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My shift ends at four, but I couldn't --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meet me at 4:01, top of the run.  That'll give you a minute to freshen up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands her the thermometer, a quick kiss and he's out t door.  The machine beeps: Johnny's temperature is 209 DEGREES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben finds Reed on a patio with a panoramic view.  Reed wo at a laptop computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long was I out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three days.  I was worried about you.  How are you feeling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben can see Reed doesn't look too solid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed shakes his head, looking back at his screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  I just keep going over and over the numbers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed.  Even you can't compute every little thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should have done more, run more tests --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben gets closer, pushing down Reed's computer screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a freak of nature.  Last I checked, you don't have a crystal ball.  Let it go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed considers.  But he can't let it go.  He opens his computer back up, returning to work.  Ben shakes his head looks out at the view.  His eyes catch on something, whee turning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go through something like this, makes you appreciate having the right woman in your life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you and Debbie and perfect --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed, I'm not talking about Debbie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed follows Ben's eyes to a lower level patio: SUE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  Come on.  She's got a good thing with Victor --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, did that cosmic-bath loosen your screws?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's smart, powerful, successful --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well maybe you should date him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed looks at Ben, resigned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben.  He'll give her the life she deserves.  She ended up with the right guy.  Things worked out for the best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed steps away.  Ben stands alone, an idea sparking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I have to do everything myself?

dialogues.text: Me like-y.

dialogues.text: Stay right.  Left is trouble.

dialogues.text: I though we went over this.

dialogues.text: She pulls down her goggles, jumps out.  Johnny drops out after her, hitting the snow.  He smolders: literally.  Th snow bank behind him sizzles and starts to melt. He takes off after her and the chase is on:

dialogues.text: The Nurse knows every inch of the trail, slicing expertly and out of the trees through deep powder.  Johnny's a spe freak, maximizing velocity, closing the gap between them. Jets of fire knife through the back of his ja The Nurse looks back: In a burst of speed, Johnny draws e She looks over and sees the flames shooting out behind hi

dialogues.text: Not this again --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No: You're ON FIRE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Care to join me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles and unzips.  The FLAMES DISSOLVE TO...CANDLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On an expansive parapet with a billion-dollar view, Victo prepares a romantic dinner-setting as his staff scurry ab He checks every fork and knife, with a slightly manic ene

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's the IPO?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stable.  We're looking at low twenties.  It's a good number, considering the fallout from --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed's disaster.  You know, I half- think he did this to me on purpose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I'm sure he wouldn't put himself --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Victor is on to the next thought, always strategizing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me on the AM shows, Larry King, cover of the Journal... (staring into silver tray) I've got to do something about this scar.  Make sure they only shoot my right side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, uh, people seem to think the scar "humanizes" you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's a good thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor looks at the scar, enraged by this defect.  It glistens in the silver tray.  His eyes are bloodshot, sleepless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, maybe you should get some rest --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later.  First, I've got some unfinished business.  A deal that needs closing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard looks at the table, the lavish spread.  A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I've always wondered... Why Sue?  You could have any woman in the world but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why.  Because I could have any other woman... You know, when they asked Caesar "why England," he said, "because it's not mine."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two dozen EMPLOYEES sit and eat.  Others serve themselves the buffet.  Ben and Sue walking into the dining hall --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can only stay for one drink, Ben.  I've got to meet with Victor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wouldn't want to keep Vic waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn a corner and find Reed, entering by another doo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Reed, what are you doing here? (before he can answer) Great, why don't you join us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He quickly shepherds the two of them toward a quiet table Ben's stomach GROWLS; so loud that they all can hear it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, I'm starving.  Gonna hit the buffet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben's stomach growls again, even louder this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is long gone, and so are most of the diners.  The room is darker, more romantic.  Ben finishes the last shr on his plate, pushes it away, belches prodigiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardon me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sue and Reed stare at him.  Ben's stomach growls again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I need to lie down.  Bad shrimp.

dialogues.text: This was Ben's plan, but he really isn't feeling well, unsteady when he walks away.  He looks down at his stomac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really bad shrimp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE: Fireplace.  Sue looks gorgeous in the light.  A be A long beat.  Reed doesn't know where to start with this woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feeling better?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good.  That's uh...good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You always had a way with words. (an awkward beat) I should be getting back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sue gets up to leave.  Exasperated, Reed tries to think o something, anything, to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm really happy for you and Victor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slows down, looking at him.  She was hoping for more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're happy for me and Victor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can tell you guys are enjoying what was the best part of our relationship --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which was?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see surprise on Sue's face, and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For science.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frustrated) You are such a dork, Reed... You never got it and never will unless it's explained to you in quantum physics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As if triggered by her emotion, the fireplace light aroun her BENDS.  The flames flicker in a ghostly breeze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  What did I say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks more disappointed than angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's never what you say.  It's what you don't say. What you don't do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lets that hang.  A lot of history here.  Quiet, hurt she wants Reed to fight for her, to show some emotion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I...I...I just wanted to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Sue's emotions swirl, she slowly...disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been two years, and all you can say is you're happy for me and some other guy... (standing up, hurt) You know, Victor may be a lot of things, but at least he's not afraid to fight for what he wants... (Reed looks down) And it's nice to be wanted sometimes.  To be heard...seen... Reed, look at me.

dialogues.text: He looks up...but all that's left of her is the blush on cheek and her bewitching eyes.  He drops his fork, shocke

dialogues.text: Uh, Sue...?  I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  What do you mean you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sue...look at your hands.

dialogues.text: Victor redirects his attention to Sue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor, I'm sorry I --

dialogues.text: Johnny does not hesitate.

dialogues.text: Look, we went up to space to find a way to understand DNA, to cure disease, save lives.  Well, now it's our DNA, our disease, our lives on the line... (a beat) Thank you.  No more questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Ned motions to the paper, the picture of BEN.

dialogues.text: You promised a cure-all, and came back with this.  Who the hell's going to invest in a biotech company that turns its workers into circus freaks?

dialogues.text: Victor's grip tightens around the table, and...the LAPTOP FLICKER, losing feeds. Victor looks down at his hands -- a private beat (did I d that?)  He lets go of the table; screens go back to norma

dialogues.text: Victor looks at him, blood boiling, and we CUT HARD TO --

dialogues.text: Sir.  Reed's comments at that press conference killed us.  How are we going to turn this around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very simple.  I cure them.  If I can cure these freaks, then I can cure anyone.  What better way to restore my reputation?

dialogues.text: Leonard nods, impressed.  Victor is a man in motion.  As step into sunlight, we cut to...CLICKCLICKCLICK in --

He passes Johnny, smiling for the camera

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Ben turns to a group of LITTLE KIDS.  Stiff, tentative:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...don't do drugs.

dialogues.text: The kids FLINCH.  Ben trudges on.  Johnny smiles bright, doing hand-signs for F4.  Sue pulls him toward --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome back to the Baxter, Dr. Richards.  All that for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He motions to the flashing cameras outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He searches for the name.  Sue steps up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy.  Good to see you again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles at Sue, then at Reed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good to see you too... Don't worry, sir.  I know how crowded that head of yours is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any visitors while I was away?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just the usual.  Told 'em you were circling round outer space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens a drawer full of LETTERS from the BANK.  Reed lo sheepish.  He shuts the drawer, looks to Johnny and Sue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had a tough year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, nine years straight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed looks at Ben.  Thanks a lot.  DING.  Elevator doors open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter.  Reed hits the top button, for the 20TH FLOOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty?  From outside the place looks a lot taller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors close, but...the ELEVATOR does not move.  A bea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Either we're moving really fast...or not at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A digital readout on the panel: EXCEED MAXIMUM WEIGHT.  A sign reads: MAXIMUM CAPACITY: 2000 pounds.  They turn to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doors open.  He lumbers out.  As the doors close behind h he looks back over his shoulder, locking eyes with Reed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator rises.  Reed roils with guilt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come Ben can't turn it on and off like us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what we're here to find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it happened to him, then it could...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happen to all of them.  Reed nods softly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait.  You mean there's chance we could be full-on-24-7-fantastic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grow up, Johnny.  You want to run around on fire for the rest of your life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that a trick question?  C'mon, I can't be the only one who thinks this is cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed considers.  But Sue cuts him short with a look. DING!  The elevator stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator opens.  They step out.  They might be on the 20th floor, but Reed owns the building from here to floor sixty.  It's a massive atrium, lit by skylights far above Reed leads them into another area filled with separate "apartments" and all the amenities of home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should stay here until we can define the extent of our changes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This place is deluxe.  You got cable?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hearing Ben's FOOTSTEPS) ...and figure out how to reverse them.  Let me show you to your rooms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The press has died down, but there are still plenty of cameras.  A MAYBACH SEDAN rolls up.  Victor emerges, wear sunglasses.  This time, the press pay no attention to him No cameras flash.  Victor tightens, and enters the buildi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sue walks out of the bathroom in a robe, drying her hair. She notices a familiar book on a shelf: a SCRAPBOOK. She flips through it.  It's filled with pictures of Reed his inventions -- a lot less fancy than Victor's multimed globe.  She stops at a picture of her and Reed in COLLEGE A noise, and she turns, flinching slightly, surprised to see...VICTOR.  He smiles, standing at the door, watching

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, I've been so worried about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She notices the scar on his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor, your scar --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, I'm fine.  It's you I'm worried about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I didn't get a chance to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, no apologies.  I've arranged for your things to be moved to one of my condos.  You'll have round-the clock care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes for her bag.  But she stops him.  A half beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, that's generous, but I think I should stay here.  With my brother.  Until we get a handle on this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor is not used to being rebuffed.  He gives a thin sm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sue.  I think you should let my doctors have a look at you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tense beat.  Standoff.  Made more tense by --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor!  What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn to see Reed approaching, with files in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm starting to wonder the same thing... How much do you know about what happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not much.  We need to run tests to see the extent of the damage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor pauses.  He looks at Sue, knowing she's here to st

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, let me know if there is anything I can do.  We're all in this together now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor shakes Reed's hand.  His GRIP is so tight that Ree fingers STRETCH.  Victor lets go, and turns to Sue, who p her hand out.  He smiles, and shakes.  He heads off. Reed looks at his hand.  Shakes his wrist.  He looks at Victor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor moves fast, holds tight to his anger.  Reed catche up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor wait... I just wanted to say, I'm sorry the mission didn't go as planned --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor suddenly WHEELS on Reed.  Lights flicker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't go as planned?  It was a catastrophe.  You ruined the lives of four people --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ruined?  With all due respect, I told you to abort --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abort?  Reed, I put my company, my name, billions of dollars on the line, and I will not let you make me look like a fool --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor, if we could understand what happened to us --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to understand it.  This isn't one of your science projects.  I just want to fix it.  Fast!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed sees Victor's SCAR maybe growing.  Lights dim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There a problem, Vic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn to see...BEN down the hall, leaning in a doorwa Victor tightens, looking at Ben's massive rock-hewn body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem, Ben.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns back to Reed.  Close, quiet.  Lights flicker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just pay your goddamn electric bill, and get to work on a cure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor steps away, toward the elevator.  He passes Ben, w just smiles and waves "goodbye."  Before Victor's finger the down-button, the button lights up (as if the circuit responded to him).  Reed exhales, shaken.  Victor steps i

dialogues.text: The doors close, and Victor really LETS LOOSE.  He SLAMS fist into a STEEL WALL.  The wall BUCKLES, steel DENTING. Victor shakes out his hand, and sees...a rippling METALLI SHELL under the skin.  He stares at it in horror.  The da surface pulsates with electric energy.  What is he becoming...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sue works the controls.  Reed approaches Ben with an ELECTRODE NEEDLE.  He tries to stick the needle into Ben, it SNAPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a chisel round here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we're going to identify the source of the mutation, we need to isolate your recombinant DNA so we can activate positional genomes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben looks to Sue for translation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to give you a physical, so we know what got zapped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well why didn't you say so?  You want me to lift some weights or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed shakes his head.  He approaches with an X-RAY MACHIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, just sit back.  We have a good sense of your strength from the firetruck.  We need to find the source of your strength.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns on the X-ray machine.  The graph shows SOLID ROC The rays don't penetrate.  Sue and Reed look confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How bad is it?  You know I used to smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed grabs a BLOOD PRESSURE MACHINE, but the strap is way short to wrap around Ben's arm.  Reed stands stumped.  He looks at his tray full of instruments.  He picks up the little rubber REFLEX-HAMMER.  But it looks miniscule comp to Ben. Reed has an idea.  He opens a drawer full of HARDWARE TOO He pulls of a real HAMMER.  He approaches Ben.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, this might smart a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He taps Ben's knee lightly, and BEN'S LEG KICKS!  SLAMMIN UP!  RIGHT BETWEEN REED'S LEGS!  The ultimate kick in the crotch.  Reed STRETCHES UP a few feet, then SNAPS BACK, wincing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (high-pitched voice) We'll...continue this later.

dialogues.text: From their second level control room, Reed and Sue observ Johnny in an enclosed fire-proof chamber.  Flames escape through the vents of the chamber...he's fully torched! Reed watches the read-out: it climbs from 2000 to 4000 degrees Kelvin.  They are essentially taking his temperat INSIDE THE CHAMBER: Johnny turns white hot, blinding to l at: the chamber walls begin to glow red.  Machines go haywire. His feet even start to LIFT OFF THE GROUND, LEVITATING a or two.  He looks down, excited, burning hotter and hotte

dialogues.text: Back it down, Johnny!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can go hotter!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He won't stop.  Reed pulls a switch on the wall.  FOAM sp out of nozzles, dousing Johnny's flames.  He stands there covered in thick FOAM.  His body steams.  So does his tem

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're really cramping my style here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were at 4000 Kelvin.  Any hotter, you're approaching supernova --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the temperature of the sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not only could you kill yourself, but you could set fire to Earth's atmosphere and destroy all human life as we know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotcha.  Okay.  Supernova bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed looks at the control panels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He cooked the equipment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frustrated, Reed looks at the smoking system.  And we CUT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed and Ben sit in chairs, facing each other.  A beat passes.  Ben taps his fingers on the chair, making small DENTS.  Reed looks down at his clipboard.  A little awkwa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  I've uh, got some questions, from Sue.  That she thought might be better coming from me... Can you, you know, go to the bathroom...like normal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. (a beat) You don't wanna know the details.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben, I'm afraid I've got to ask --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not unless you want that clipboard stretched up your --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O-kay.  We'll skip that question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed and Johnny now.  Johnny exercises.  Reed stands near Clipboard in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there something about flames?  About flaming, that you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you trying to say?  Just because I dress well and like to dance --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) What?  No.  I'm trying to figure out why we each ended up with different symptoms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, well that's easy: I'm hot.  You're...well, you're a little limp.  Sue's easy to see through.  And Ben's always been a hardass. (a beat) Why aren't you writing this down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed sighs.  It's going to be a long process.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed and Sue, tables turned: Reed observes her through a prismatic device measuring light refraction.  He "sees" h through the device: lit up like some heavenly creature. having a hard time concentrating.  He focuses on his work

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not "invisibility" per se.  You're bending the light around you with some kind of malleable force field.  That's what you projected on the Bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about you?  You haven't eaten in days.  How come you're never on this side of the microscope?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tightens, uncomfortable with being center of attention She reaches for his arm, like a specimen.  He pulls away, she sees a glimpse of BRUISES on his ARMS.  She slows dow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruises...from the bridge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods, rolls down his sleeves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you had any side-effects, from your powers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She considers.  A little vulnerable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've had some headaches.  Migraines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.  Reed drops his eyes, makes a note, back to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should be able to bend light around other objects, even people, if you could control your emotional state better --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is annoyed.  Reed is oblivious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm saying, if you had a little more self control, you could locate the trigger.  Can you remember the exact emotions when --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anger.  Rage.  Frustration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Is there any way to duplicate that feeling?  Some memory or...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staring right at him) I'm sure I can come up with something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at Reed, eyes narrow.  She becomes invisible. she focuses on Reed -- and gets angry -- a small, clear F FIELD forms around her body.  The force-field BENDS LIGHT around a MICROSCOPE, which goes INVISIBLE.  Reed steps ou ask...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's that coming -- whoa --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FORCE-FIELD shoots in all directions, knocking everyt over in a fifteen foot radius.  Reed is thrown from his chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I'm sorry, I didn't mean to do that... You must think that was some kind of latent hostility or --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What in the world would give me that idea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An awkward beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, you broke up with me, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I distinctly remember: you walked out my door.  Ergo...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She didn't want to get into this.  She looks down, vulnerable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed.  I was ready for the next step, you weren't, ergo, I walked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it was a little more complicated than --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanted to share an apartment.  What was so complicated about that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The question stumps him.  A beat.  He struggles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There were a lot of variables to consider --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  There weren't.  There was you.  And me.  No variables, no math.  It was actually the simplest thing in the world.  But your head got in the way... like it always does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her words penetrate.  He knows she's right.  He looks awa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sue...I just...I thought...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He struggles for the words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same old Reed.  Too much thinking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens his mouth, but...WHAM!  Doors open.  Johnny ente wearing a CHARRED SHIRT.  He points to the burned scraps his shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay guys, we have a serious problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLES of Reed in the lab, grabbing their space uniforms various closets/containers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our uniforms were exposed to the storm like us.  So they can transform like us, becoming invisible, changing size on demand or remaining impervious to flame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL: Reed, Sue, and Johnny step out to look at themsel in a mirror wearing the uniforms.  No boots, no gloves. yet.  (The uniforms will develop, like our heroes).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look like an eighties rock band.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ben) The suit will stretch.  You should try it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't be caught dead in that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's right.  These costumes are... missing something.  I can't put my finger on it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not costumes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not taking them out.  Johnny, we need to stay here till we've stabilized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny shakes his head, frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm getting sick of being trapped here.  NASA wasn't even this strict!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He marches out.  Sue turns to Reed, who says nothing.  Su heads out, leaving Ben and Reed.  A beat.  Ben looks at R

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at uniform) Maybe it's missing a utility belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Reed's dark look, we hear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's the prognosis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: an X-RAY.  Victor's ARM.  The metallic transformation is higher now.  PULL BACK TO REVEAL: Victo and his DOCTOR.  In the wall behind them: ancient armor (maybe we noticed it before, maybe not).  It adds a littl menace to the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your tissue, your organs, your entire biophysical structure is changing.  Every system is still functioning, somehow --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they're changing into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't really know.  A compound organic-metallic alloy.  Stronger than titanium or carbon steel.  Harder than diamonds --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like the shields Reed said would protect us. (cold fury, deadly focus) How long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At this rate, the infection should be complete in two, maybe three weeks --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean "complete"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I could tell you.  I can't pretend to know what we're dealing with here.  I'll notify the CDC and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor hardens, razor sharp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Center for Disease Control.  If this thing is contagious --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHHM!  Victor GRABS the Doctor by the throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at me.  I have a life.  I'm the face of a billion-dollar-company... We need to keep this confidential, understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor's grip TIGHTENS around the man's throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...this disease...is progressive... degenerative...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's terrible news...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With one cobra-swift move, Victor thrusts his metallic ar into the doctor, killing him instantly.  Victor retracts arm, and looks at it, shocked by his own strength.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but I think I'll get a second opinion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SERIES OF TIME-LAPSE SHOTS: REED works around the Baxte Building, spending hours searching for the cure.  He chec charts, writes equations, paces, frustrated. Finally, he sits at his long desk, looking at a wall wher Ben's CHARTS are projected (both Ben and Thing's anatomie Reed wears the uniform under his labcoat.  He checks his equations over and over, making notes upon notes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing...nothing...nothing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hits the end of the slides.  The wall fills with white light.  Frustrated, Reed SLAMS his head into his desk, CR Something FALLS off the end of the desk. Reed raises his head, revealing his flattened face.  He s over to see...a PLANT SAMPLE from space, glass box shatte Red sparks swirl around the plant, like the cosmic storm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course...of course...the cloud...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE COSMIC STORM swirls, terrifying.  We slowly PULL BACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STORM is a computer-image on screen now.  Behind the screen are six chalkboards full of Reed's calculations an the scribbled beginnings of a MACHINE. We PULL BACK to see his arm stretched across the room wri on the end of another chalkboard. He's moving fast, excited, almost a little manic.  He hears...a CREAK.  He slows down, but doesn't look up to s SUE enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fast, charged) The plants, from space.  Their particles are still charged.  With the right amount of energy, those ions could create the elemental profile of the cosmic storm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rifles through a desk drawer, then heads out.  Sue sta there, looking at the storm.  Concerned.  Then we CUT TO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sue follows Reed.  He flips through a file, excited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we can build a machine to re-create the storm, we can reverse the polarity --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (realizing) And reverse the mutations --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (talking more to himself) Curing countless diseases, not just ours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we're the focus, right Reed?  Reed...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.  Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you sure you can control this thing?  Last time didn't work out so well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (preoccupied, mind spinning) With the right energy, we can stabilize the storm.  Maybe tie into the city grid...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He keeps his head down, making notes, entering --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed and Sue enter.  Reed is looking for something.  Sue slows down, staring at this sprawling space, jam-packed w GEAR, GADGETS, BLUEPRINTS, INVENTIONS.  Awe-inspiring, overflowing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really need to get a janitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares at shelves upon shelves of overcrowded clutter

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This must be what it looks like inside your head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed finds his electron microscope.  He turns to Sue, defensive:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a system to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts to pull out a MODEL of the FANTASTICAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait!  Sue, don't touch tha--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The little car sets the whole shelf off balance.  A WAVE INVENTIONS COME CLATTERING DOWN!  Reed moves fast: He LUNGES toward Sue, STREETCHING his ARMS AROUND the SHE pushing Sue away, just as the INVENTIONS SMASH TO THE GRO Reed and Sue hit the floor.  A close call.  Now more closeness: Sue and Reed lay face-to-face, with Reed's wra around her.  A heated beat.  Their first real intimate moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.  My fault.  I won't...touch anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As if suddenly made aware of their vulnerability, Sue and Reed stand, backing off.  As they part, we see: BEN watching from the doorway.  Melancholy.  He disappear We slowly MOVE TO...A SURVEILLANCE CAMERA in a VENT GRATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor watches a bank of videoscreens.  He has the Baxter Building under surveillance.  He sees Reed and Sue on monitors.  He toys with Sue's diamond ring in his gloved hand. A door opens.  Leonard enters.  He sees the screens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Reed any closer to a cure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor looks at that image of Reed and Sue on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only thing he's closer to is Sue...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Victor sees something between Reed and Sue on the wal He leans closer, and the camera ZOOMS IN, as if respondin his will.  He ZOOMS all the way to a CLOSE UP of: REED'S BLUEPRINTS FOR THE TRANSFORMATION CHAMBER.  Victor eyes narrow, mind ticking, a plan forming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make me a reservation for two at Cipriani tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor opens a drawer, pulls out an old VIDEOTAPE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And get this over to Ben Grimm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor leans forward, fixated on that machine.  As he get closer, his screens go STATICKY.  He absentmindedly picks his SCAR.  In shadows, we see skin peeling off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
